Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Global Warming: Wine Production, Green Burial & LEED Bldg.)
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: B-2: STEALTH AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The most expensive and specialized airplane ever built, the B-2 Stealth bomber carries a price tag of more than two billion dollars. Highly effective and extremely technically advanced, it has been an integral part of the Air Force arsenal for the past 20 years.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Thanks to a dramatic repair mission, the Hubble Space Telescope has another chance to capture more stunning pictures like only it can. See how the final tune up came together and what Hubble has learned since.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Gigantic telescopes of the future with multiple mirrors working in unison like the Spitzer Space Telescope, will see further than the Hubble Space Telescope, and possibly get our first pictures ever of another planet that can support life as we know it.

Clip.Title: B-2: STEALTH AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The most expensive and specialized airplane ever built, the B-2 Stealth bomber carries a price tag of more than two billion dollars. Highly effective and extremely technically advanced, it has been an integral part of the Air Force arsenal for the past 20 years.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.Episode: From the Republic of San Marino to Pontecchio Marconi
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the Republic of San Marino to Pontecchio Marconi, see a mosaic of villages, nature and art cities with a background of roaming motors and Verdi's classical symphonies.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Fiorano to Castell'Arquato we continue our journey from Rimini on the Adriatic coast to Ravenna, to admire the beautiful mosaics of the Byzantine Art. See Bologna and its ancient University to Ferrara and its prestigious past linked to the Estensi family.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Canada's easternmost point to Europe's westernmost point, this aerial survey explores the Atlantic coastline, from the wonders of St. John's Newfoundland and the Avalon peninsula - to the unique islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: B-2: STEALTH AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The most expensive and specialized airplane ever built, the B-2 Stealth bomber carries a price tag of more than two billion dollars. Highly effective and extremely technically advanced, it has been an integral part of the Air Force arsenal for the past 20 years.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet performs revolutionary surgical techniques to save the lives of his four legged patients. See Oscar the cat get a bionic foot transplant and Mayo the arthritic dog, an "X-Men" inspired surgical procedure.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: About the size of Texas, the island country of Papua New Guinea sits just to the North of Australia. At Papua's far eastern tip lies Milne Bay - holding one of the planet's highest concentrations of marine species.

Clip.Title: BLOOD RIVER CROSSING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A baby zebra and his mother join hundreds of thousands of wildebeest and other herbivores on a bloody mission through the predator-packed expanses of the Serengeti-Mara ecosystem. Their mission is survival, but when the mother and son become separated in the crocodile-infested Mara River, each must fight its own battle alone.

Clip.Title: DEATH BEACH
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A high number of fatal shark attacks along a South African beach leads a marine biologist on a mission to explain these predators' overly aggressive behavior.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The vaults and labs of the Smithsonian feature fascinating stories about "the birds and the bees." From public health concerns, to shifting societal norms, to the complex mating habits found in the wild, join host Tom Cavanagh as he goes behind the scenes of the Smithsonian to find evidence of romance and yes, sex.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: join host Tom Cavanagh (from TV's "Ed") as we explore the crime "scene" at the Smithsonian's Vaults: photographic evidence from the Crime of the Century; everyone's favorite natural villain, the snake; and America's first "Lone Gunman": John Wilkes Booth.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Did da Vinci actually leave hidden clues in his paintings? Is there indeed a secret society protecting the bloodline of Christ? Join our team of real-life code breakers, Renaissance experts, and professors of religion and language as we uncover the truth behind this controversial film.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The vaults and labs of the Smithsonian feature fascinating stories about "the birds and the bees." From public health concerns, to shifting societal norms, to the complex mating habits found in the wild, join host Tom Cavanagh as he goes behind the scenes of the Smithsonian to find evidence of romance and yes, sex.
